individual_metadata.synopsis: A merchant selling in the bazaar on the ground floor of Moonrise Tower. He is a passionate bugbear who believes only the strongest should enjoy the Absolute's spoils. Players can earn his respect for a discount.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Speak to the Bugbear on the bottom floor of MOO.

AD_Combat.synopsis: Bugbear vendor yells at the player when entering combat. If at least one of the players had impressed him, he wil look forward to the challange of fighting them. If they failed to impresse him, he will taunt them. If not of the players attempted to impress him, he will be existed for the bloodshed regardless.
AD_Combat.how_to_trigger: Impress/fail to impress bugbearvendor in moonrise towers bazaarenter combat with himwait till it's his turn

50.speaker: Lann Tarv
50.text: If you have coin, then show it.
50.context: NodeContext: suspicious, weighing up the person he's greeting

53.speaker: Player
53.text: To mock me is to beg for death.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Don't provoke me - I have a short temper.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: You'll never peddle your wares with that attitude.

12.speaker: Lann Tarv
12.text: I do not peddle. I put weapons in worthy hands.

81.speaker: Lann Tarv
81.text: The Absolute needs warriors for Her crusade. But I see only weaklings in this place.
81.context: NodeContext: Faintly disgusted - he looks around and sees typically 'non-monstrous' races - the kind his people usually prey on

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Your tone is asking for a beating, bugbear.

22.speaker: Lann Tarv
22.text: Hah! Bark, bark. Like a worg pup, you are.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: You want a warrior? Here I am.

5.speaker: Lann Tarv
5.text: Prove it. Who's singing your name?

37.speaker: Lann Tarv
37.text: Thought so. Lucky you're with the Absolute or I'd sell you nothin'.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Just show me what you have.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Bet the hag who ripped my eye out is howling from the grave.

51.speaker: Lann Tarv
51.text: A hag? Now that's an ugly and glorious song.
51.context: NodeContext: impressed - just heard that you killed a hag

118.speaker: Lann Tarv
118.text: Want anything from my stash, you pay less than the rest.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: What do you have on offer?

98.speaker: Player
98.text: If your stomach's strong enough, I'll tell you how I lost this eye.

113.speaker: Lann Tarv
113.text: Say no more. An eye's a hard thing to lose - worth a chorus of blood and bone.
113.context: NodeContext: impressed by the wound he was just shown in a 'you should see the other guy' kinda context

9.speaker: Lann Tarv
9.text: I took someone's eye out for spilling my drink in the war camps last night. Don't prove nothing.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: The bastards who took my eye aren't singing. They're screaming in the Hells.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: The Absolute is. I burned that druids' grove to the ground.

70.speaker: Lann Tarv
70.text: That was you? Hells, I'll sing your name myself for that.

125.speaker: Lann Tarv
125.text: That might have been a pretty slaughter, but I heard Minthara led the attack.
125.context: NodeContext: dismissing a claim to glory he just heard - and Minthara will have 'a lament' because she's about to be sent for execution

138.speaker: Player
138.text: Dror Ragzlin isn't. I ripped him and his camp apart.

10.speaker: Lann Tarv
10.text: That was you? I heard Ragzlin was tough as dragon meat.

76.speaker: Lann Tarv
76.text: That so? Heard that was a traitor, myself.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: The demons of the abyss sing my name and tremble.

2.speaker: Lann Tarv
2.text: Glorious. And they gave you some handsome scars.

132.speaker: Lann Tarv
132.text: Looks like a demon chewed you up and spat you out. You couldn't make a goblin tremble.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: You'll be shrieking my name if you keep asking inane questions.

116.speaker: Lann Tarv
116.text: Hrrr. Looks like there's bite in you yet.
116.context: NodeContext: amused - just got threatened and was impressed by the bravery of the person threatening him

91.speaker: Lann Tarv
91.text: People must scare easy where you're from. I don't.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Nobody sings my name - I don't leave any witnesses.

93.speaker: Lann Tarv
93.text: Doubt you've done anything worth witnessing.
93.context: NodeContext: using the word 'witnessing' in response to a player saying they don't leave witnesses

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Friends and enemies alike - for I wield the power of the divine with the ease of breathing.

79.speaker: Lann Tarv
79.text: The only god who holds power here is the Absolute - remember that.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: The skies themselves - when they bow to my magic and unleash a tidal wave of power.

49.speaker: Lann Tarv
49.text: Magic with a bite, eh? That's worth a chorus of blood and bone.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Well, I mainly do the singing. Usually while beating my foes to a pulp - it's quite the sight.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Nobody sings my name - I don't leave any witnesses.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: Footprints in untrodden places sing my travels and trials.

23.speaker: Lann Tarv
23.text: Thought I smelt something... outlandish about you. Very well.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Check the calluses on my hands. Those come only from a steadfast grip on a weapon.

44.speaker: Lann Tarv
44.text: I'll give you that. Songs lie, flesh can't - and you look plenty battle-worn.

94.speaker: Lann Tarv
94.text: Shame I'm not selling aloe, then - keep your ugly hands to yourself.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Check my knuckles - I've felled plenty of foes with my fists alone.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Those who'd bind another to their will whisper my name in nightmares.

84.speaker: Lann Tarv
84.text: Normally talk like that's empty - but there's something behind those words of yours. I can feel it.

133.speaker: Lann Tarv
133.text: And they're singing, are they? Strange, all I hear is self-righteous horsecack.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Perhaps 'warrior' isn't the right word. But I could turn this tower to dust without twitching my finger.

85.speaker: Lann Tarv
85.text: Well, now - looks like there's something swinging beneath those robes after all.

124.speaker: Lann Tarv
124.text: Whole lot of talk, and still you've managed to say nothing.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Open shop, or it will be you howling my name and begging my mercies.

48.speaker: Lann Tarv
48.text: Hah! So there's a little spice to go with all that strange.
48.context: NodeContext: No innuendo - just commenting approvingly on Lae'zel's boast / looks

33.speaker: Lann Tarv
33.text: Mercy, mercy, please - I might just wet myself.
33.context: NodeContext: Patronising guffaw at our threat - next lines goes to flat, abrupt threat

109.speaker: Player
109.text: Oh, no one sings it. But hundreds have died sobbing with my name on their lips.

7.speaker: Lann Tarv
7.text: Always special when it's just for your ears alone, ain't it?

55.speaker: Lann Tarv
55.text: You're certain they weren't just falling asleep?

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Screaming my name, more like. I know how to inflict pain. Show respect, or I'll give you a demonstration.

115.speaker: Lann Tarv
115.text: Big talk from a little girl. And I believe every word.

157.speaker: Lann Tarv
157.text: Respect is earned, elf. Not offered up to them as stamp their foot for it.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I have cut from corpses a thousand tongues, and those thousand tongues sing of murder.

80.speaker: Lann Tarv
80.text: The bridge to glory is built on the bones of the dead.

95.speaker: Lann Tarv
95.text: You know - I think I recognise you. And I still can't remember your name.
95.context: NodeContext: Leading us on for a moment - second half is the put down.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: The Weave itself - for I traverse its depths with the ease of breathing.

153.speaker: Lann Tarv
153.text: Bookish nobodies are of no interest to me.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: Nature's beasts - with fangs of fury and unsheathed claw.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: Z'rell said you're to share her private stash with me.

59.speaker: Lann Tarv
59.text: Took a liking to you, did she? Watch yourself - she breaks her toys once she's done with them.

82.speaker: Lann Tarv
82.text: You seek arms? I seek a warrior worthy to bear them.
82.context: NodeContext: gruff greeting to somebody he doesn't respect

144.speaker: Lann Tarv
144.text: The Absolute's war drums beat loud in your chest. How may I serve?
144.context: NodeContext: warm greeting to a person he respects

AD_Combat_0.speaker: Lann Tarv
AD_Combat_0.context: NodeContext: Entering combat with relish - he was extremely bored

AD_Combat_1.speaker: Lann Tarv
AD_Combat_1.text: Time to put your tales to the test, warrior!
AD_Combat_1.context: NodeContext: Excited anticipation, not entirely unfriendly - yes he's about to kill us, but we told him enough stories of our exploits that he's excited by the challenge

AD_Combat_2.speaker: Lann Tarv
AD_Combat_2.text: I hope you do battle better than you boast, pup.
AD_Combat_2.context: NodeContext: A little bored - fighting us might be a chore. (We told him tales of our exploits before, but he was unimpressed)
